alert.note: Alert for Outagamie; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 5:08PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Winnebago, northeastern Waushara, southeastern Waupaca and southwestern Outagamie Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 508 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fremont, or 13 miles southeast of Waupaca, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New London, Appleton, Little Chute and Black Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central, northeastern and east central Wisconsin.
